name: Cross borders with Expedico!
author: Expedico

sections.description:
Use Expedico plugin to ship your parcels to various countries in Europe directly from WooCommerce. Download parcel labels in bulk or individually for each order. Get automatic updates of parcel status as well as order status in WooCommerce.

Functions

  • Connection to various courier services in Europe
  • Cash-on-delivery supported
  • Automatic update of parcel status including update of order status
  • Bulk download and printing of shipping labels
  • Delivery to pickup points and parcel lockers in Europe
  • Map for selection of pickup points directly from your cart

FAQ

Is this plugin free?

Yes, all plugin functions are free without limitations.

How do I start?

  1. Create Expedico account and complete the setup at https://expedico.eu/register
  2. Install and activate the Expedico plugin in your WordPress administration: https://wordpress.com/support/plugins/install-a-plugin/#how-to-install-a-plugin
  3. In the Main menu select the tab Settings and then Expedico
  4. Fill your Expedico API credentials, sender ID and choose label format, then save
  5. After filling API credentials, please select your allowed carriers
  6. After selecting the allowed carriers, enter the shipping rates for each carrier
  7. If you want to ship to pickup points, in Woocommerce shipping settings, add Expedico Pickup Points shipping method and enter 0 as the price (the price will be calculated in the cart based on the prices entered in point 6.)
  8. If you want to ship to an address, in Woocommerce shipping settings, add Expedico Delivery shipping method and enter 0 as the price (the price will be calculated in the cart based on the prices entered in point 6.)
  9. Done
sections.changelog:
2.0.0

  • Delivery to address
  • Direct connection to Expedico API
  • Automatic order status synchronization from Expedico API

1.0.0

  • Initial plugin version

short_description: Single point for your ecommerce parcel delivery, returns handling and fulfillment services mainly in Eastern Europe.
